channel.title: nlin.SI updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: nlin.SI updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: On B type family of Dubrovin-Frobenius manifolds and their integrable systems
item.description: arXiv:2309.09054v2 Announce Type: replace Abstract: According to D.Zuo and an unpulished work of M.Bertola, there is a two--index series of Dubrovin--Frobenius manifold structures associated to a B type Coxeter group. We study the relations between these structures for the different values of these indices. We show that part of the data of such Dubrovin--Frobenius manifold indexed by $(k,l)$ can be recovered by the $(k+r,l+r)$ Dubrovin--Frobenius manifold. Continuing the program of arXiv:2007.11974 we associate an infinite system of commuting PDEs to these Dubrovin--Frobenius manifolds and show that these PDEs extend the dispersionless BKP hierarchy.
item.dc:creator: Alexey Basalaev

item.title: Reality conditions for the KdV equation and exact quasi-periodic solutions in finite phase spaces
item.description: arXiv:2312.10859v4 Announce Type: replace Abstract: In the present paper reality conditions for quasi-periodic solutions of the KdV equation are determined completely. As a result, solutions in the form of non-linear waves can be plotted and investigated. The full scope of obtaining finite-gap solutions of the KdV equation is presented. It is proven that the multiply periodic $\wp_{1,1}$-function on the Jacobian variety of a hyperelliptic curve of arbitrary genus serves as the finite-gap solution, the genus coincides with the number of gaps. The subspace of the Jacobian variety where $\wp_{1,1}$, as well as other $\wp$-functions, are bounded and real-valued is found in any genus. This result covers every finite phase space of the KdV hierarchy, and can be extended to other completely integrable equations. A method of effective computation of this type of solutions is suggested, and illustrated in genera $2$ and $3$.
item.dc:creator: Julia Bernatska
